channel.title: Dear Cast & Crew
channel.description: Open letter film reviews, essays, and exchanges.

item.title: Feature: The 16 Sexiest Roles on a Film Set
item.description:
Dear Film Fans,
Is Hollywood's rush to give young directors the key to the blockbuster kingdom robbing them of their chance to grow as artists?p>

item.title: Feature: The Value of a Veteran Filmmaker
item.description:
Dear Freshman Filmmakers,
Is Hollywood's rush to give young directors the key to the blockbuster kingdom robbing them of their chance to grow as artists?p>

item.title: Feature: A Conversation with Big Game Director Jalmari Helander
item.description:
Dear false,
C. Redmond speaks with Finnish director Jalmari Helander about breaking into the Hollywood game, what’s wrong with most action movies today, and who he wants to make the next big action star.p>

item.title: Feature: Requiem for an Underdog
item.description:
Dear 1985,
1985 was the hardest year of my life, and one movie helped me get through it. One gloriously bad movie that celebrates its 30th anniversary this year. That movie is Rocky IV.p>

item.title: Feature: The Superhero Craze Isn't Superficial
item.description:
Dear Fellow Comic Book Fans,
Marvel movies are mirroring today's society more than you might think.p>

item.title: Feature: We Need to Talk About Adam
item.description:
Dear Adam Sandler Fans,
If you're still a fan of Adam Sandler, the joke's on you. Di Golding gives the man-child's fans an overdue spanking.p>

item.title: Feature: Superman v Star Wars: The Blockbuster Awakens
item.description:
Dear Readers,
How the new trailers for Star Wars and Batman v Superman are the first blows in a battle to define the future of the big-budget epic.p>

item.title: Feature: A Conversation With Director Denis Villeneuve
item.description:
Dear false,
C. Redmond speaks with the incredible French-Canadian director about his chances of winning, maintaining his signature in Hollywood, and the upcoming _Blade Runner_ prequel.p>

item.title: Feature: A Conversation With Pretend We're Kissing Writer/Director Matt Sadowski
item.description:
Dear false,
Di Golding talks to Pretend We’re Kissing writer/director Matt Sadowski about the challenges of making a “non-rom-com” and how to film a perfectly awkward sex scene.p>
